top_comment.text:
Team Cat Mojo working here - I have taken care of a feral cat colony for 
more than a decade. I started with 42 cats in the colony. I tamed them and 
found many new homes. I have 22 left in the colony and they are all safe 
now from getting hit by cars etc. due to my building them a shelter with 
their own little house in my yard.

With some help from other local rescue groups I was able to get all of them 
spayed or neutered so no more kittens. I often wonder when doing an 
adoption if the people adopting realize their cats entire story and that he 
or she started out completely feral. I pay for all their food each week 
myself and have a great vet that lets me make payments so I don't go broke 
for regular vet care or emergencies.

I do plan on keeping a few of them and those few are not up for adoption. I 
will be both happy and sad on the day when I have just those few left.

- Heidi﻿
top_comment.author: BlackCat2

comments.text:
And another wingless angel here on earth!  You are such a blessing - maybe 
a broke blessing, but still a blessing!  I know the feeling.  At one point 
we were up to 19 cats, now down to 11. Just the feeding takes so much 
money. We've built shelters and cat houses (thank goodness for the Habitat 
Restore having cheap plywood pieces). When one gets hurt, we go to the vet. 
I wish one of the vets around here would let me make payments but none of 
them seem to worry much about the animals, just their money. The vet I go 
to most often does try to keep the costs down but there is nothing free. I 
understand they're in business but jeez, their prices are astronomical! The 
nearest Humane Society hospital is 1 1/2 hours from here. But, that's the 
price of caring for them - I would gladly go hungry if it meant my kitties 
were medically taken care of! Once you've snuggled with a cat, had it press 
up to you and purr, curl up in your arms, if you've got a heart, you're 
hooked!
comments.author: Uncommonsensesc

comments.text: How wonderful. Bless you.
comments.author: Terry R

top_comment.text:
Jackson, i really want a cat but i get hives on my legs when they knead on 
me. Is there a way to prevent hives from having a cat? (I pet the 
neighborhood cats. they all let me) ﻿
top_comment.author: PawProductions12

comments.text:
Building immunities DOES work. I'll get itchy red eyes from being in the 
same room as a cat, but after visiting and owning a cat for a few months, 
I'm fine.
+PawProductions12 You could consider getting shots for the immunities since 
hives are pretty serious for allergies, or you can just not let them knead 
you. If you get a cat, you can find one that isn't a lap-cat since they 
don't usually like standing on you and stuff.
comments.author: Junivale Amethyst

comments.text:
If you are allergic to cats, it'll depend on how bad you're allergic. If 
it's too bad, you may have to go with a hairless cat. I believe in trying 
to build immunities to them. I'm allergic to cat saliva as well as cat 
dander, and short-haired cats work better for me than long-haired. I have 
to start out with them in my basement, visiting it several times a day, for 
a few weeks. Then I start letting it upstairs for short spurts, and each 
time is a few minutes longer, until they have full reign of the house. I 
always have Benedryl on hand, but it might be wise to also have an Epi-pen 
for severe allergic reactions. If you ever have to use the Epi-pen, your 
cat owning days may be over.
comments.author: drfreud65

top_comment.text:
My bf and I bought a sick cat without knowing it (We have learned 
something, yes), but that's another story about irresponsible breeders, who 
pperantly had 16 cats and couldn't afford dental cleans for them. That kind 
of people shouldn't even be allowed to have pets!! But our girl has 
paradentosis and when we got her, she had a severe mouth infection as well. 
She went to surgery a couple of times, got a lot of her teeth removed and 
then we gave her antibiotics and pain relief for a few weeks. Our vet 
described it as we worst case she's ever seen with bacteria eathing so much 
of her gums, her teeth were loose and there was even dead tissue in her 
mouth from years of suffering. Today she is still having the aggressive 
illness, but we are controlling it. We go for regular check-ups and at the 
vets hospital. She has started to eat a lot more, groom herself again and 
she's much more playful and happy. If we didn't take her, she would've 
probably been euthanized because her mouth and teeth would be in such an 
awful shape. She means the world to us, and we are so happy that she isn't 
suffering anymore!﻿

comments.text:
+Samantha Callaway Why do people do this to animals?  When there are so 
many resources available to help out people who don't want/ can't keep

deserve this kind of treatment?  Thank God you were there to rescue her and

comments.author: Karen Carter

comments.text:
hey jackson please read this! your videos are what made me want to get a 
kitten in the first place! me and my friend ended up taking in two baby 
black cats earlier this year that we adore, voodoo and karma both females. 
they are now almost a year old and we knew we wanted black cats because of 
all the bad superstion thats linked to them and its sad but they dont get 
adopted as frequently as other colored cats. well today i was standing 
outside and saw a truck pull up in a parking lot and throw this frail black 
cat onto the ground, the lady then opened the door jumped out and stomped 
the cats mid section twice as hard as she could and just left but when 
leaving ran over the cats tail. i imediately ran to the cat to make sure it 
was okay luckily nothing is broken i took her to the vet and they said she 
is about four and very under weight you can see all of her bones just by 
looking at her. i decided today after her horrible luck to add her to the 
family! i am a fairly new cat owner but i am so passionate about these 
animals that i am going to start helping out at a local shelter also. salem 
my new female cat has had no aggression towards voodoo and karma and they 
in return just seem to be curious but welcoming towards her. your videos 
have helped so much if i have any questions i always take a look at them 
and you have the answers you are doing what you were put on this earth to 
do and you seriously have saved so many lives because i know im not the 
only person that has had an experience like this. without you i never would 
have had the courage to try to take on three cats under the same roof.. but 
today that same courage you gave me is what saved a four year old cat from 
being abandoned and starving thank you so much jackson.
comments.author: Samantha Callaway

comments.text:
+Freja Nordvoss Well Link and my parents dog Pyry get along just fine so I 
don't think he has problems in getting along with the puppy when we adopt 
one but Link was my first cat when I moved away from home so he thinks he 
is the most important cat in the world. He didn't like my boyfriend at 
first and was jealous about him but eventually he started to like him more 
and more. When I saved Jade, Link was like: Hey wait a minute... Is he 
staying here? You've got to be kidding me. But they got along great after 
few days. And when I adopted Lara, Link just looked at me like: Really? 
Really!? Are you serious? You did it again!
It's funny how Link starts to purr when my parents dog comes to visit :3 
Pyry was the first animal he met after I adopted him and I think he likes 
Pyry (who is a westie) because he is calm and likes to sleep next to Link. 
Pyry is used to cats because we had one when we adopted Pyry 10 years ago 
and Link is just like that cat :)
comments.author: DrenRenova Renn

comments.text:
+DrenRenova Ulla Heinonen LOL, he'll get used to it I think :P I'd follow 
Jackson's advice on introducing new pets. It made a ton of sense. In my 
case I've never had a puppy or kitten and my mate and I were hoping that if 
we get them together, they'll grow up used to each other. We also happen to 
not have an issue with shelters or puppy mills here, so I don't feel that 
it's an issue getting a young kitty :)
I'm very glad to hear it too. I know lots of people think it's radical or 
unreasonable to outright hate religion, but I tried for so long to justify 
it and the more I saw, the more I just shook my head. To me, I wanna look 
at it in a factual way. Countries that have lots of religion and in 
particular the abrahamic ones have a lot more violence, zealots and 
religious based hatred for others. They all teach acceptance of others and 
do unto others as you would have done unto you, but not one of them follows 
it, especially not to the letter. I think humans are too biased and well, 
not evolved enough in that way to follow it. I'll be the first to say I 
can't help feeling uncomfortable around certain people because only two or 
three of that race or religion acted out in a terrible way. I know 
logically that very few are even like that, but emotionally I become 
damaged. The rule of always being kind is too difficult when we're colored 
by one experience.

Sorry for long ranting, I'm just glad I can share my thoughts on this too. 
It's rare to find someone who agrees on this, maybe not with all my points, 
but on the basic idea :)
comments.author: Vixx “Sinvanor” Celacea

comments.text:
+Freja Nordvoss We too are gonna adopt a puppy when we move into a bigger 
apartment :) I can already see the face of my oldest cat Link :D he will be 
like: Human... you didn't. And btw It's accually nice to hear that other 
people think that religion is a bad thing. I've been told( by religious 
people) that I'm too judging towards them so that makes me a bad person. 
I've never acted directly against religion or told someone that I don't 
want to be around them because they belive in god but many religious people 
have said that because I don't share their beliefs I am a bad person and 
that they don't want to be part of my life.
comments.author: DrenRenova Renn

comments.text:
+DrenRenova Ulla Heinonen
I'm an ex-Christian myself and it's so weird to see things from the 
otherside. Personally, I find most religions if not all about selfishness 
and cruelty. And like you said, not all of them do that, but it's too 
common to simply be a coincidence or say that it's the individual, not the 
religion. It often is the religion and in particular the Abrahamic 
(Judaism, Christianity and Islamic) seem to have the worst zealots and 
cruelties among them. To me I think religion is a mental illness, something 
that anyone can "contract" because our brains have a particular part that 
seems to deal with what we perceive as  supernatural. I also have come to a 
point where I don't think anything can be just personal to that persons 
life. What we believe in seems to affect how we react and treat anything 
and everything else in our lives. Which is why I'm personally against 
religion.
On a happier note, my boyfriend and I are definitely getting a cat and a 
dog when we move to a place more suited to it )
comments.author: Vixx “Sinvanor” Celacea

comments.text:
+Freja Nordvoss I totally agree with you about cults and religion. I'm an 
atheist and in my opinion world would be a better place without religion. I 
know that not all believers are evil cultists who torture animals and stuff 
but I still think there would be less "evil" without religion. I know for 
some people religion gives purpose and hope and I don't want to undermine 
their beliefs but my experience about religions are bad. And about the 
people who abused Jade... they were around 20 to 30 years old and 
Christians who interpreted the bible in their own twisted way. I think 
people who harm animals should be treated the same way they treat humans 
who harm other humans. Human who hurts helpless animal is a coward.
I'm glad I managed to save Jade :) I love him and want to protect him from 
harm.
And to everybody who doesn't have a cat. Adopt one :) they bring so much 
into your life.
comments.author: DrenRenova Renn

comments.text:
+DrenRenova Ulla Heinonen
And that makes me hate religion more then I already do. That's terrible. 
Maybe we should make a time machine and send them all to the mayans where 
ritual cult like sacrifices and tortures were done. Human psychology those 
that it wouldn't make a difference. We unfortunately don't learn that 
hitting hurts when we get hit back after hitting someone. Instead, we just 
do tit for tat.
I hope at some point people will stop participating in any religion/cult 
that engages in behavior that harms others.
Bet it was teenagers. I hated teens when I was a teen. Unstable and zero 
impulse control or critical thinking ability. Society should actually start 
realizing that teens are mentally unfit to just do whatever. They need a 
place to express their frustration at their hormones and brain 
transformation.
Anyway, sorry for the rant, I just get so pissed when I read about that 
kinda stuff, specially when it's a helpless animal. It's the most cowardice 
thing a person can do. I'm so glad you were able to save her and that she 
has a happy loving home and family :)
comments.author: Vixx “Sinvanor” Celacea

comments.text:
I have three cats. Two of them were adopted from farms but one of them I 
had to save. My neighbor told me about a kitten who was abused and beaten 
in the midst of some young religious people  in a cult of some sort and 
told me that if I did not help him, Jade would most likely die. I wasn't 
planning on taking another male cat after Link but how could I say no. So 
the next day my neighbor went there to get Jade and brought him to me. I 
thought he would be terrified of everything after all the cruelty he had 
endured but the moment he arrived into my apartment he melted my heart with 
his loving personality :3 He was thin and his fur was in really bad shape 
but in few weeks he started to look much better. I really think animals 
know when they are being helped because when jade arrived he looked me and 
I think he was thinking that he was save with me. So that's my cats rescue 
story :)
comments.author: DrenRenova Renn

comments.text:
#TeamCatMojo 
I rescued a very pretty kitty from going to animal control, right before 
she was sent to them from the community I am a part of. They were going to 
put her down because she was a stray, I was not having that. I took her in 
and discovered she was pregnant. not only did I save her, but I saved her 5 
kittens as well. Even got them to good homes once they were old enough. 
kept one of the kittens and mama. then again it turned out we would be 
taking in another abandoned kitty, a little orange boy soon named leo. he 
was hurt, and scared, yet purred as soon as he was taken in the front door. 
Guess he knew this would be his home XD. just wanted to share the story, 
love all that you do Jackson.
comments.author: Amand Harris (Crystaldrago)

comments.text:
Hello Jackson my name is Erin and This is the story of deep sadness and 
learning to love again , It has been a least four years since the 
heartbreak I had felt after losing three cats one of witch was an old cat 
named Annie I had witnessed he being thrown out a car window but when I 
went up to her she was not hurt, thank god and was the sweetest thing EVER 
despite her traumatic experience. The second one we adopted, BB, Was 
unsocial and took a lot of time and love but our family snuggled our way 
into his heart. The last cat was a 6 week old kitten given to us by a 
hoarder (at that time we did not know this) after we found out he was male 
he was given the name Duncan. And after a long series of unfortunate events 
all three had to go. After such a long time dealing with my mental 
disabilities I had grew cold to animals,  So my mother decided to change 
that we traveled to a shelter and it just ... happened our eyes met and 
slowly she blinked at me and stuck her paw out to me, At that moment  we 
both knew this was meant to be. So with the speed of a jet, Opal came into 
my life and taught me to smile again and I will be in her debit forever. 
#Team CatMOJO
comments.author: -Fuzzy Camo Dog-

comments.text:
All logical I suppose. Also can keep down on vet bills by keeping cats 
indoor only.
comments.author: TinyElephantGenius

comments.text:
+TinyElephantGenius
If I only had one cat, I would insure him/her, but I have three and the 
economics don't add up. It is better to keep a vet slush fund if you have 
more than one cat imho. If you've had cats in the past, add up what you 
spent on vets over their lifetime, divide that by the number of years they 
lived, add some on for inflation, then you have a rough figure of what vet 
bills are likely to be. Take the monthly insurance payment, work out what 
you'd pay over a year, then work out the cheapest option. But remember that 
some circumstances, like being hit by a car, will involve abnormally high 
bills. That's where a good slush fund helps.
For one cat, it pays to insure as you're not paying multiple insurance 
premiums.
comments.author: muskndusk

comments.text:
Pet insurance lacks regulation and can really screw you over. It may be 
better just to save whatever amount you would have been willing to pay in 
insurance premiums each month. That is what I do. I save $40 a month per 
cat.
comments.author: TinyElephantGenius

comments.text:
That's great, just consider all the costs involved. Food is fine as it's an 
easy ongoing expense, but vet bills can really hit you hard. If you can, 
get your cat insured.
comments.author: muskndusk

captions.text:
(MIMICKING MORSE CODE)
Da, da, da, da, da, da.

Stand by for a special
bulletin from the cat cave.

If this were a true
mojo emergency,
you would be notified.
Da, da, da, da.
It's a true mojo emergency.
Standby.

Are you ready to
catify the world?
It's crucial.
Let's go.

I want to tell you
about what happened
to me just a few weeks ago.
I was on the plane.
I was in a pretty crappy mood.
I was overworked.

About four hours
into the flight,
I had to go to the bathroom.

So I'm walking up the aisle, and
the flight attendant stops me.

And she goes, now, we
have to talk about my cat.
We start talking about her cats.

In the meantime,
there was a guy--

and he was obviously
a flight attendant

himself-- and his name is
[? Knoll. ?] Says here,
I want you to see something.
And he pulls out his phone.
This is my cat.

My cat would be dead
if it weren't for you.

Turns out, that through
watching "My Cat From Hell"

and being a part of team Cat
Mojo, went to the shelter,

picked this cat up,
who would surely

have been dead if
it weren't for him.

And man, pow, just knocked
me off my feet, man!

In that moment, I was
absolutely validated.

All of the years that I've put
into this, a lot of sacrifice,

personal life, my
aspirations as a musician,

in that one moment,
[? Knoll ?], you
put my life back in perspective.

And man, I could not
thank you enough.

If you're watching this, I want
to see a picture of your cat
again.

I want you to send
it in so I can

show the rest of
team Cat Mojo, OK?
Now, let's talk about you.
OK?

Because of course this is
a special message to you.
You have saved a life probably.

But it's important to know that
you can save so many more just
by lifting a pinky.

Well, if we love cats, let's put
our money where our mouth is.
What can you do today?

I'm talking to you
guys, to team Cat Mojo.

Because you are the
ones who will help

us turn this corner,
to never kill

another animal just because of
the crime of not having a home.

And you can do that just
by telling your friend
to spay or neuter their animal.
Can you foster an animal?
Give money?

Find an organization that
you really get behind,

that you really jive with, and
help them spread their mojo?

And get involved with
TNR, trapping, neutering,

and returning community cats to
the places where they belong.
Go volunteer at a shelter.

What if you shared
your expertise,

that one the micro
specialty that you work in
in the real world?

Website designer, marketing
specialist, interior designer.

Everything that you
do can translate

into something that will
save thousands of lives.

So do it That's your
homework, folks.
Do it.
Be that angel.

It doesn't take as much
as you think it does.

And I'm telling you,
the payoff is gigantic.

There's another part
to your homework.

Folks, if you have an
animal in your life,

and you know that there's
a person out there

responsible for that animal's
life, I want to know about it.
We all want to know about it.

Calling out all
mojo angels, man.
That's your homework.

Bring those mojo angels
to the forefront.

I want to know names, and I want
to know if you have a picture.

Or I want to see the
picture of the animal

so that you can say,

just like I'm saying
[? Knoll, ?] thank you.

You can be Knoll,
and you can be me.
Boom!
We're done.
Folks, I'm out.

Don't forget, you can
find me everywhere

Please do find me.

and I will find it, OK?
